92.title: National Commission on Terrorist Attacks upon the United States. The 9/11 Report : a Graphic Adaptation
92.author: by Sid Jacobson and Ernie Coln ; with a foreword by Thomas H

contents.title: "We have some planes"
The foundation of the new terrorism
Counterterrorism evolves
Responses to Al Qaeda's initial assaults
Al Qaeda aims at the American homeland
From threat to threat
The attack looms
"The system was blinking red"
Heroism and horror
Wartime
Foresight and hindsight
What to do? A global strategy
How to do it? A different way of organizing the government.

notes: "Based on the final report of the National Commission on Terrorist Attacks upon the United States".
Comic book about the September 11, 2001 terrorist attacks.

93.title: Spider-Man and Power Pack.

notes: In separate stories, Spider-Man rescues a boy from a molesting baby-sitter, and the Power Pack finds a runaway who has been unable to convince her mother that her father is abusing her sexually.
"Produced in cooperation with the National Committee for Prevention of Child Abuse." 1. Child abuse

101.heading: National Conferences.
101.title: "Famous Last Words"
101.author: Alison Bechdel
101.appears_in: p. 74-75 in Dykes to Watch Out for : the Sequel (Ithaca, N.Y. : Firebrand Books, 1992)
notes: Summary: Ginger has indulged in flirtatious behavior at the national lesbian conference, and says it's nothing; then Malika sends her roses. The cigar-smoking, anchor-tatooed delivery man says, "A Ginger Jordan live here, Sonny?" To which Lois replies, "Yes, she does! Thank you kindly, Ma'm!"

113.heading: National Debt.
113.title: Americathon 1998
113.author: adaptation by Philip Proctor and Peter Bergman.
notes: "The year: 1998. The place: America. The problem: The country is fuel-less, an Indian is about to foreclose on the national debt, and the President, a graduate of primal grop therapy, is a nincompoop! The answer: A 30-day, rollicking, rolling, rip-roaring telethon to save the nation!"

174.heading: National Identity in Latin/o American Comics.
174.title: Redrawing the Nation : National Identity in Latin/o American Comics
174.author: edited by Hctor Fernndez L'Hoeste and Juan Poblete.
notes: "This volume discusses the role of comics in the formation of a modern sense of nationhood in Latin America and the rise of a collective Latino identity in the USA. It is one of the first attempts, in English and from a cultural studies perspective, to cover Latin/o American comics with a fully continental scope. Specific cases include cultural powerhouses like Argentina, Brazil, and Mexico, as well as the production of lesser-known industries, like Chile, Cuba, and Peru."
